page.title: 07Arts & Crafts
page.content: The area offers several crafts-people and artists. Retired people do knitting, crochet, macrame work and various artistic hobbies. Working people find time to enjoy spinning, weaving, crocheting, lacemaking and art. Local craft classes are held in the winter months for lampshade making and needlework. There are dairy related crafts for example butter making, cheese and yoghurt. Many people do home needlework including embroidery. There is also a lithograph printer in the area as well as a porcelain potter who does retail work. Flower arranging is another popular hobby in the village. By Mrs Beck
